items.english: A method for minting new symbols to decrease sequence length while increasing symbol size.

items.english: A professional proposal or presentation aimed at persuading an audience.
items.original_context: He gave a sales pitch to the potential customers.
items.example: The entrepreneur delivered an impressive pitch to secure funding for her startup.

items.english: Excessive or exaggerated publicity or promotion.
items.chinese: 对某事物过度宣传、炒作
items.original_context: Hype Train (炒作之车)： 指那种全民疯狂期待某种新产品的现象。
items.example: The hype surrounding the new smartphone led to record-breaking pre-orders.

items.english: To interact or communicate with something or someone.
items.original_context: I tend to be pretty measured when it comes to interfacing with the AI hype machine.
items.example: The software allows users to interface seamlessly with multiple devices.

items.english: To encounter or discover something accidentally.
items.chinese: 无意间遇到, 不经意闯入
items.original_context: We've stumbled into workflows that leave me with considerable optimism for what's possible.
items.example: She stumbled into a hidden talent for painting during her art class.

items.english: Relating to or involving right angles; independent or unrelated.
items.original_context: orthogonal: 正交的, 垂直的.
items.example: The two strategies are orthogonal and can be implemented simultaneously without conflict.

items.english: To reduce in size, importance, or value.
items.original_context: His authority is diminishing.
items.example: The constant criticism began to diminish her confidence.

items.english: To decrease or deteriorate gradually.
items.original_context: His health is declining.
items.example: The company's profits have declined for three consecutive quarters.

items.english: Having the opposite effect of what was intended.
items.original_context: Counter-productive 是“帮倒忙”（倒退）。
items.example: Micromanaging the team proved to be counter-productive, stifling creativity and efficiency.

items.english: To act or react quickly, often without careful consideration.
items.chinese: 迅速做出反应; 立即行动
items.original_context: I generally leap to exclaim that's what context engineering is all about.
items.example: He leaped to defend his colleague when the accusations were made.

items.english: To connect or resonate with someone or something on an emotional or intellectual level.
items.chinese: 与... 共鸣, 与.. 合拍
items.original_context: You talk (or drunkenly shout) back and forth with it, vibing your way through a problem.
items.example: The team was vibing well during the brainstorming session, generating innovative ideas.

items.english: To deviate from the intended course or topic.
items.original_context: We are getting off track.
items.example: The discussion got off track when participants started debating unrelated issues.

items.english: The act of guiding or controlling the direction of something.
items.original_context: A slightly smarter way is to just start over when you get off track, perhaps with a little more steering in the prompt.
items.example: The manager's steering of the project ensured its successful completion.

items.english: The power to influence or direct behavior or the course of events.
items.original_context: Control 是“控制生死/开关”，Steer 是“掌握舵盘/导向”。
items.example: The manager maintained strict control over the project to ensure its success.

items.english: To guide or direct the course of something.
items.original_context: Steer 是“掌握舵盘/导向”。
items.example: The captain skillfully steered the ship through the storm.

items.english: To preoccupy or fill the mind of someone continually and to a troubling extent.
items.original_context: obsess: 痴迷 why obsess over context
items.example: She tends to obsess over minor details, often losing sight of the bigger picture.

items.english: To hold and use a weapon or tool; to have and be able to use power or influence.
items.chinese: 熟练掌控, 有效运用
items.original_context: wield: 熟练掌控, 有效运用 this is true for wielding codeing agents as it is for general agent design.
items.example: The politician wielded his influence to pass the new legislation.

items.english: A means of exerting influence or achieving a result.
items.original_context: lever: 杠杆 That is, the contents of your context window are the ONLY lever you have to affect the quality of your output.
items.example: The company used its market dominance as a lever to negotiate better deals.

items.english: Proven to be effective or reliable through practical experience or rigorous testing.
items.original_context: battle-tested: 经过实战经验的 it comes with battle-tested workflows that enable AI to solve hard problems in large, complex codebases.
items.example: The battle-tested software has been used successfully in numerous high-stakes projects.

items.english: A suffix used to indicate approximation or a slight degree of something.
items.chinese: 表示有点多, 差不多
items.original_context: -ish: 表示有点多, 差不多, small-ish 有点小, 算比较小. five-ish: 大概五点左右, blue-ish: 有点蓝
items.example: The room was clean-ish, but it could use a bit more tidying up.

items.english: A state of dissatisfaction, disturbance, and agitation, often involving public demonstrations or protests.
items.original_context: unrest: 不稳定的状态. but the biggest source of internal unrest and frustration on the team was the lack of mental alignment.
items.example: The political unrest in the region has led to widespread protests.

items.english: To explore caves, especially as a hobby.
items.original_context: spelunk: 探险. I can't go spelunking through 40+ files of daemon code for an hour+ when something is broken.
items.example: The adventurous group decided to spelunk through the uncharted cave system.

items.english: To complete a task or activity as quickly as possible, often with efficiency.
items.original_context: speed-run: 快速完成. I can steer a research prompt to give me the speed-run on where I should be looking and why.
items.example: The team managed to speed-run the project, finishing it ahead of schedule.

items.english: A creative work, especially a musical composition or a significant piece of art.
items.original_context: opus 作品集, 杰作 our team of three is averaging about $12k on opus per month.
items.example: The artist's latest opus is a stunning masterpiece that has captivated audiences worldwide.

items.english: Made into a commodity; standardized and widely available.
items.original_context: comoditized 使商品化. I'm reasonably confident that coding agents will be commoditized.
items.example: As technology advances, many specialized tools have become commoditized and accessible to the masses.

items.english: Optimistic or confident about something, especially in terms of financial markets or prospects.
items.original_context: bullish: 乐观的. We're pretty bullish on spec-first, agentic workflows, so we're building tools to make it easier.
items.example: Investors are feeling bullish about the company's new product line.

items.english: Strong criticism or opposition.
items.chinese: 严厉批评, 激烈反对
items.original_context: flak: 严厉批评, 激烈反对. she caught some flak 她挨了一顿猛劈
items.example: The politician faced significant flak for his controversial remarks.

items.english: A situation characterized by back-and-forth or up-and-down movement or change.
items.chinese: 跷跷板: 引申为两端来回拉扯的此消彼长
items.original_context: see-saw: 跷跷板: 引申为两端来回拉扯的此消彼长. (there's always a see-saw between functionality consolidation and developer customization)
items.example: The negotiations were a see-saw of concessions and demands from both sides.

items.english: Something that comes before another and may lead to or influence its development.
items.chinese: 某个事物的前身或先驱
items.original_context: precursor: 某个事物的前身或先驱. first usage of Intellisense(precursor to tab-complete).
items.example: The steam engine was a precursor to modern industrial machinery.

items.english: Designed to remain useful or relevant in the future.
items.original_context: future-proof: 面向未来, 可持续.
items.example: The software was designed to be future-proof, accommodating updates and new technologies.

items.english: A collection of things lying about in an untidy state.
items.original_context: clutter: 杂乱, 冗余的内容, and conventions that might clutter a README or aren't relevant to human contributors.
items.example: The desk was covered in clutter, making it hard to find anything.

items.english: A practical method or approach to problem-solving that is not guaranteed to be optimal but is sufficient for immediate goals.
items.original_context: Heuristic 指的是一种“经验法则”或“投机取巧”的办法，它不保证 100% 完美，但足以解决大部分问题。
items.example: The team used a heuristic approach to quickly identify the most likely cause of the issue.

items.english: To examine one's own thoughts and feelings.
items.original_context: introspect: 内省 反省
items.example: After the heated argument, she took some time to introspect and understand her emotions.

items.english: A set of instructions or rules, especially for evaluation or grading.
items.original_context: rubric 评分标准
items.example: The teacher provided a detailed rubric to guide students in completing their assignments.

items.english: The capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
items.original_context: resilience: 弹性. 恢复力
items.example: The community showed remarkable resilience in rebuilding after the natural disaster.

items.english: A system for organizing and isolating names to avoid conflicts, often used in programming or technical contexts.
items.original_context: namespace: 分组并隔离名字
items.example: The developer used a namespace to ensure the code modules remained isolated and conflict-free.

items.english: Designed for efficiency and comfort in the working environment, often tailored to human use.
items.original_context: the tools that are most “ergonomic” for agents also end up being surprisingly intuitive to grasp as humans.
items.example: The new office chairs were praised for their ergonomic design, which reduced back strain during long work hours.

items.english: To set up or establish something quickly.
items.chinese: 快速建立或设置某事物
items.original_context: Start by standing up a quick prototype of your tools and testing them locally.
items.example: The team managed to stand up a new server within minutes to handle the increased traffic.

items.english: Relating to or situated on the edge or periphery; secondary or minor.
items.original_context: Peripheral features, prototyping.
items.example: The manager decided to focus on core functionalities rather than peripheral features during the initial phase.

items.english: Combined and condensed from multiple sources into a single, coherent document.
items.chinese: 从多个来源整合并提炼成一个连贯的文档/指南
items.original_context: Synthesized troubleshooting guides and runbooks from multiple sources.
items.example: The report was synthesized from various academic papers to provide a comprehensive overview of the topic.

items.english: Operational, step-by-step guides used during routine procedures or incidents.
items.chinese: 运行手册/操作手册，常用于 SRE/运维场景
items.original_context: Runbooks: Operational, step‑by‑step guides used during routine procedures or incidents.
items.example: The team relied on detailed runbooks to handle the unexpected server outage efficiently.

items.english: In a way that covers a large area or has a wide scope; thoroughly.
items.chinese: 广泛的, 大量的, 深入的
items.original_context: Use custom slash commands extensively.
items.example: The researcher extensively reviewed the literature to ensure no critical studies were overlooked.

items.english: To simplify and optimize a process, making it more efficient and smooth.
items.chinese: 简化并优化流程, 使其更高效顺畅
items.original_context: These custom commands streamline specific workflows and speed up repeated tasks.
items.example: The company streamlined its hiring process to reduce the time-to-hire by 50%.

items.english: A single repository that stores code for multiple projects or components.
items.chinese: 将多个项目或组件的代码集中存放在一个单一的代码仓库中
items.original_context: Monorepo: 是指将多个项目或组件的代码集中存放在一个单一的代码仓库中。
items.example: The team adopted a monorepo structure to improve collaboration and reduce dependency conflicts.

items.english: To use something to maximum advantage, often implying a powerful resource.
items.original_context: Leverage it for documentation.
items.example: The startup leveraged its small size to quickly adapt to market changes.

items.english: To give someone or something the authority or power to do something; to strengthen or enhance.
items.chinese: 通过这个工具来加强文档工作
items.original_context: Empower your documentation with it.
items.example: The new policies were designed to empower employees to take initiative in their roles.

items.english: To be exceptionally good at or proficient in something.
items.original_context: Claude Code excels at synthesizing documentation and creating structured outputs.
items.example: She excels at public speaking, captivating her audience with every presentation.

items.english: The ability to understand something deeply and thoroughly.
items.original_context: Codebase comprehension.
items.example: The course is designed to improve students' comprehension of advanced mathematical concepts.

items.english: The ability of a system to record and allow users to retrieve previously entered commands.
items.chinese: 计算机系统记录并允许用户重新调用之前输入过的命令的功能

items.example: The terminal's command recall feature saved the developer significant time during debugging.

items.english: Not simple or obvious; requiring careful thought or complex handling.
items.chinese: 不简单的, 非显而易见的；非常正式, 需要深入研究

items.example: Designing a scalable architecture for the application was a non-trivial task. | The solution to the problem was non-trivial and required extensive collaboration.

items.english: Capable of being done or achieved within the given constraints.
items.original_context: Which wasn’t feasible before given the time investment required.

items.english: The practice of using one's own product in real-world scenarios to test and validate it.
items.chinese: 公司内部先用自己开发的产品，在真实工作场景里“自我试用”和验证
items.original_context: Model iteration testing through dogfooding.

items.english: Additional costs, burdens, or resources required to complete a task.
items.original_context: Context-switching overhead.

items.english: Obstacles or inconveniences that slow down or hinder work or processes.
items.chinese: 让工作变慢或不顺的障碍与不便

items.example: The new interface design significantly reduced friction in the user experience.

items.english: The least amount necessary to meet a requirement, often implying minimal effort.
items.original_context: Begin with just the bare minimum of what you need and let Claude guide you through the process.

items.english: To expand or develop a framework or system by adding more components or extending its reach.
items.chinese: 强调扩展与规模化；扩展或完善框架

items.english: Emphasizing growth and expansion of marketing channels to achieve larger-scale results.
items.original_context: Scaling performance marketing channels (强调规模化增长)
items.example: The team is focused on scaling performance marketing channels to reach a broader audience efficiently.

items.english: Creating and setting up marketing channels from scratch to drive performance.
items.chinese: 强调从 0 到 1 的建立
items.original_context: Establishing performance marketing channels (强调从 0 到 1 的建立)
items.example: The startup is establishing performance marketing channels to build its initial customer base.

items.english: Designing and structuring marketing channels with a high-level strategic approach.
items.chinese: 强调架构设计，非常高端
items.original_context: Architecting performance marketing channels (强调架构设计，非常高端)
items.example: The marketing team is architecting performance marketing channels to ensure scalability and efficiency.

items.english: Surpassing the anticipated or required level of achievement.
items.chinese: 不仅达标, 而且超额完成
items.original_context: exceeding expectations: 不仅达标, 而且超额完成
items.example: The project exceeded expectations by delivering results ahead of schedule and under budget.

items.english: Achieving exceptional results or operating at a top level of efficiency.
items.original_context: high-performing: 高水平 / 顶尖
items.example: The high-performing team consistently delivers innovative solutions to complex problems.

items.english: Experiencing strong growth or success, often exceeding expectations.
items.chinese: 蓬勃发展 / 超出预期
items.original_context: thriving / flourishing: 蓬勃发展 / 超出预期
items.example: The startup is thriving in the competitive market, with its innovative products flourishing globally.

items.english: Belonging to the highest level or category in terms of quality or performance.
items.original_context: top-tier 处于顶尖系列

items.english: Operating or executing processes on a large scale, efficiently and systematically.
items.original_context: at scale: 在大规模下、规模化地
items.example: The new software allows businesses to manage their operations at scale without compromising quality.

items.english: Basic or simple, lacking advanced features or refinement.
items.chinese: 初级的、基础的、粗浅的、未完善的
items.original_context: rudimentary: “初级的、基础的、粗浅的、未完善的”
items.example: The prototype is rudimentary but serves as a proof of concept for the final product.

items.english: Initial or preparatory, serving as a starting point before further development.
items.original_context: Preliminary 侧重“开头”
items.example: The preliminary analysis provided a foundation for the detailed research that followed.

items.english: A type of storage device that uses flash memory to store data, offering faster access speeds than traditional hard drives.
items.original_context: solid state drive - ssd (固态硬盘)
items.example: The laptop's solid state drive ensures quick boot times and efficient data retrieval.

items.english: A type of memory used in computers that stores data dynamically and requires constant refreshing.
items.original_context: dynamic random-access memory: DRAM: 动态随机存储器
items.example: The computer's DRAM allows for faster processing of applications and multitasking.

items.english: Focusing on a specific area of expertise or skill.
items.chinese: 专门从事, 专注于某领域或技能
items.original_context: specializing: 专门从事, 专注于某领域或技能.
items.example: The team is specializing in building AI products to revolutionize the industry.

items.english: Leading the way in innovation or development, often in a groundbreaking manner.
items.original_context: Pioneering: 如果你的 AI 产品具有创新性。
items.example: The company is pioneering the development of AI technologies that will transform healthcare.

items.english: Covering a large area or scope, often implying a significant amount of detail or effort.
items.original_context: extensive: 有时会让人联想到“冗长”（wordy）
items.example: The report provided extensive details on the project's progress and future plans.

items.english: Thorough and complete, covering all relevant aspects in a strategic and professional manner.
items.chinese: 全面的, 具策略性的
items.original_context: comprehensive: 听起来更具策略性和专业性
items.example: The comprehensive guide helped the team navigate the complex project requirements.

items.english: Detailed and thorough, providing deep insights or analysis.
items.original_context: In-depth: 强调“有深度、透彻”
items.example: The in-depth study revealed critical insights into consumer behavior.

items.english: Careful and meticulous, ensuring no detail is overlooked.
items.chinese: 严谨的, 不放过任何细节
items.original_context: Thorough: 强调“严谨、不放过任何细节”
items.example: The thorough review of the design ensured all potential issues were addressed.

items.english: Strong and reliable, capable of withstanding challenges or scrutiny.
items.chinese: 扎实的, 经得起推敲的
items.original_context: Robust: 强调“扎实、经得起推敲”
items.example: The robust architecture of the system ensures its stability under heavy workloads.

items.english: A set of characters with a consistent visual style, such as Times New Roman, Helvetica, or Inter.
items.original_context: “typefaces” 指“字体款式/字形设计”，也就是一套具有一致视觉风格的字符设计（例如 Times New Roman、Helvetica、Inter）。
items.example: The designer carefully selected typefaces to ensure the branding was consistent across all platforms.

items.english: To imagine or foresee something clearly in one's mind, especially a future event or outcome.
items.original_context: “envision” 的意思是“设想、想象、预见”。
items.example: She could vividly envision the success of her innovative project.

items.english: To systematically plan, outline, or organize something in detail.
items.original_context: “map out”“map out” 的意思是“（系统地）规划/梳理/勾勒出”。
items.example: The team mapped out the entire project timeline to ensure timely delivery.

items.english: The state or process of adhering to laws, regulations, and standards.
items.chinese: 遵守法律与监管要求的状态与过程
items.original_context: “legal compliance” 指遵守法律与监管要求的状态与过程。
items.example: The company implemented new policies to ensure legal compliance with international trade regulations.

items.english: To make a profound or significant change in form, nature, or function.
items.original_context: transform: 意味着根本性的、深刻的变革。
items.example: The new software aims to transform the way businesses manage their operations.

items.english: Made more efficient and effective by simplifying or eliminating unnecessary steps.
items.original_context: Streamlined core workflow: 如果你的改动是让流程更简洁、去掉了繁琐步骤。
items.example: The company implemented a streamlined process to reduce production time.

items.english: Made as effective, perfect, or functional as possible.
items.original_context: Optimized core workflow: 如果你的改动是让流程运行得更快、成本更低。
items.example: The team optimized the website to improve loading speeds and user experience.

items.english: Renovated, improved, or revised, often with a modern or innovative touch.
items.original_context: Revamped core workflow: 如果你对旧流程进行了翻新/大修（带有一点酷酷的极客感）。
items.example: The revamped user interface received widespread praise for its modern design.

items.english: Operated or controlled by machines or computers, reducing the need for human intervention.
items.original_context: Automated core workflow: 如果你通过技术手段实现了自动化。
items.example: The automated system significantly reduced manual errors in data processing.

items.english: Having the ability to cause a significant or fundamental change.
items.chinese: 具有变革性的、能带来重大改变的
items.original_context: transformative: “具有变革性的、能带来重大改变的”。
items.example: The introduction of renewable energy sources has been transformative for the energy industry.

items.english: To supervise or monitor a process or activity to ensure it is carried out correctly.
items.original_context: provide oversight: 监督
items.example: The manager was tasked to provide oversight for the new project to ensure its success.

items.english: To perform or repeat a process or procedure multiple times to improve it.
items.original_context: iterate: 反复迭代 循环改进.
items.example: The team iterated on the design until it met all the client’s requirements.

items.english: To become apparent, important, or prominent.
items.original_context: several successful patterns for effectively using Claude Code have emerged across our community of users
items.example: New trends in technology often emerge from unexpected innovations.

items.english: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
items.original_context: This versatile workflow suits many problems:
items.example: The versatile tool can be used for both professional and personal projects.

items.english: A state of action characterized by taking bold steps without seeking prior approval.
items.chinese: 无审批, 敢做就做的状态
items.original_context: safe YOLO mode: you only live once: 用来形容: 无审批, 敢做就做的状态
items.example: The startup adopted a safe YOLO mode to quickly test innovative ideas without bureaucratic delays.

items.english: To apply or transfer patches from one codebase or system to another.
items.chinese: 把补丁“嫁接/移植”到另一处代码或系统上
items.original_context: graft patches: 把补丁“嫁接/移植”到另一处代码或系统上
items.example: The developers had to graft patches from the old system to ensure compatibility with the new software.

items.english: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
items.original_context: aesthetic: 美学的, 审美的 make aesthetic improvements
items.example: The architect focused on the aesthetic appeal of the building, ensuring it blended seamlessly with its surroundings.

items.english: To elevate or improve something to a higher standard or level.
items.original_context: uplevel: 提升, 升级: uplevel with multi-claude workflows
items.example: The company decided to uplevel its customer service by implementing advanced AI chatbots.

items.english: The process of distributing tasks or operations across multiple entities or systems to handle large-scale operations.
items.original_context: Fanning out (分批处理)handles large migrations or analyses
items.example: The data migration process was optimized by fanning out the workload across multiple servers.

items.english: In a significant or substantial manner.
items.original_context: “materially (~2.5x) more productive”表示生产率提升是实实在在、幅度很大，远不只是小改进或微弱提升。
items.example: The company’s profits were materially impacted by the new regulations.

items.english: Done or acting according to a fixed plan or system; methodical.
items.original_context: it's about creating systematic human-AI collaboration through meticulously crafted shared context
items.example: The scientist conducted a systematic review of the data to ensure accuracy.

items.english: In a way that shows great attention to detail; very carefully and precisely.
items.original_context: it's about creating systematic human-AI collaboration through meticulously crafted shared context
items.example: She meticulously planned every detail of the wedding to ensure perfection.

items.english: To make or produce something skillfully.
items.original_context: it's about creating systematic human-AI collaboration through meticulously crafted shared context
items.example: The artisan crafted a beautiful vase from clay.

items.english: Groups or collections, often used to describe collaborative systems or integrated algorithms.
items.chinese: 偏向算法集成, 表达人机协作的感觉
items.original_context: Human and multi-agent ensembles consistently outperform single agent or agent only approaches.
items.example: The research team used ensembles of algorithms to improve the accuracy of their predictions.

items.english: The combined effect of two or more elements that is greater than the sum of their individual effects.

items.english: A discussion that provides detailed information about the background, purpose, justification, and technological feasibility of a proposed or final rule.
items.original_context: A preamble is a discussion that provides detailed information about the background, purpose, justification, and technological feasibility of a proposed or final rule.
items.example: The preamble to the constitution outlines the fundamental principles of the nation.

items.english: To contribute an opinion or perspective to a discussion.
items.original_context: weigh in:
items.example: Experts were invited to weigh in on the implications of the new policy.

items.english: Equal in quality, status, or performance.
items.original_context: on par with: I believe it's either on par with or even outperforms the 405 billion version of the llama model from before llama 3.1
items.example: Her skills are on par with the best in the industry.

items.english: Code that connects different software components or systems.
items.original_context: glue code:
items.example: The developer wrote glue code to integrate the new API with the existing system.

items.english: To take or seize something quickly or eagerly.
items.original_context: grab:
items.example: She managed to grab the last seat before the train departed.

items.english: To push something forcefully or hastily.
items.original_context: shove: grab some relevant data to the question and shove it in the prompt.
items.example: He had to shove the heavy box into the storage room.

items.english: Genuine or authentic.
items.original_context: legit: 正当的. a very ligit good answer.
items.example: The document was verified as legit by the legal team.

items.english: More substantial or robust.
items.original_context: beefier: 更深入的. beefier chat.
items.example: The new version of the software is beefier, offering enhanced features and performance.

items.english: Practical and effective.
items.original_context: nifity: 实用的
items.example: The nifty gadget made cooking much easier and faster.

items.english: Skillful or clever, often in a deceptive way.
items.original_context: cunning: 巧妙的, cunning piece of logic in there that plucks out the right function.
items.example: The detective used cunning tactics to uncover the truth.

items.english: To extract or remove something.
items.original_context: plucks: 提取
items.example: She plucks the ripe apples from the tree every autumn.

items.english: Made to appear more impressive or important than it actually is.
items.original_context: glorified: 美化的
items.example: The job was nothing more than a glorified internship.

items.english: General agreement among a group.
items.original_context: consensus: 开创
items.example: The team reached a consensus on the project's direction after hours of discussion.

items.english: An official order or authorization to do something, often given by voters to a government.
items.original_context: mandate: 授权
items.example: The president has a mandate to reform healthcare.
items.memory_trick: Think of it as an official OK from people in power

items.english: Weaknesses or flaws in a system that can be exploited.
items.example: We found several vulnerabilities in the legacy code.

items.english: Based on observation, experience, or experiment rather than theory or pure logic.
items.chinese: 经验主义的；基于观察或实验的
items.example: The scientist gathered empirical evidence by conducting multiple experiments. | Empirical research shows that sleep improves memory retention.
items.fun_fact: From Greek "empeiria" meaning "experience" — same root as "expert"!
items.memory_trick: Think: EMPIRICAL = EMPirical + IRL (in real life) — based on real-life experience, not theory

items.english: A restrictive measure that limits movement, access, or activity, often for security or public health reasons.
items.chinese: 封锁；限制活动（通常出于安全或公共卫生原因）
items.example: The city went into lockdown during the pandemic. | The school was placed on lockdown after a security threat.
items.fun_fact: Originally a prison term — when a facility is "locked down," all inmates return to their cells. Became widely known during COVID-19.
items.memory_trick: LOCK + DOWN = everything gets LOCKed and calms DOWN. Think of a prison or a city freezing in place.

items.english: The ability to read and write; also used broadly for competence in a specific area.
items.chinese: 识字能力；读写能力；（某领域的）素养
items.example: Adult literacy programs help people learn to read and write. | Digital literacy is essential in today's workplace.
items.fun_fact: From Latin "littera" meaning "letter." Being literate literally means knowing your letters!
items.memory_trick: LITERACY = LETTER + ACY (quality of). The quality of knowing your letters.

items.english: Seeming reasonable or believable; apparently valid or likely.
items.chinese: 看似合理的；貌似可信的
items.example: Her explanation sounds plausible, but we need evidence. | It's a plausible theory, but it hasn't been proven yet.
items.fun_fact: From Latin "plausibilis" meaning "worthy of applause" — something so good it deserves clapping! Now it means "worth believing."
items.memory_trick: PLausible = PLausible sounds like APPLAUSE. If something deserves applause, it's convincing. A plausible story makes you want to clap!
